alert.note: Alert for Blount; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 8:55AM CDT until July 20 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN BLOUNT, SOUTHERN KNOX AND NORTHWESTERN SEVIER COUNTIES... At 955 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges still indicated thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing over western Knox County with at least one road reporting over 2 feet of water over it near the West Town Mall. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will still experience flash flooding include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Alcoa, Farragut, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Seymour, Kimberlin Heights, Lake Forest, Wildwood, McMahan, Bearden and Harrisburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
